verses.kjv: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.
verses.web: Listen to this word which I take up for a lamentation over you, O house of Israel.
verses.ct: Listen to this message I am raising against you — a funeral song for the house of Israel.

verses.kjv: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.
verses.web: “The virgin of Israel has fallen; She shall rise no more. She is cast down on her land; there is no one to raise her up.”
verses.ct: "Young Israel has fallen and will never get up again. She lies abandoned on her own land, with no one to help her to her feet."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the Lord GOD; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.
verses.web: For the Lord LORD says: “The city that went out a thousand shall have a hundred left, and that which went out one hundred shall have ten left to the house of Israel.”
verses.ct: The Lord GOD says: "A city that sends out 1,000 soldiers will have only 100 come back. A city that sends out 100 will have only 10 return to the house of Israel."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:
verses.web: For LORD says to the house of Israel: “Seek me, and you will live;
verses.ct: The LORD says to the house of Israel: "Come to me, and you will live.

verses.kjv: But seek not Bethel, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beersheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Bethel shall come to nought.
verses.web: but don’t seek Bethel, nor enter into Gilgal, and don’t pass to Beersheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Bethel shall come to nothing.
verses.ct: But don't go looking for me at Bethel. Don't make pilgrimages to Gilgal, and don't travel to Beersheba. Gilgal will be dragged off into exile, and Bethel will be reduced to nothing.

verses.kjv: Seek the LORD, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Bethel.
verses.web: Seek LORD, and you will live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and it devour, and there be no one to quench it in Bethel.
verses.ct: Seek the LORD, and you will live. Otherwise, he will sweep through the house of Joseph like a fire that devours everything, and no one in Bethel will be able to put it out.

verses.kjv: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,
verses.web: You who turn justice to wormwood, and cast down righteousness to the earth:
verses.ct: You are the ones who turn justice into something bitter as wormwood and throw righteousness to the ground.

verses.kjv: Seek him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD is his name:
verses.web: seek him who made the Pleiades and Orion, and turns the shadow of death into the morning, and makes the day dark with night; who calls for the waters of the sea, and pours them out on the surface of the earth, LORD is his name,
verses.ct: Seek the one who made the Pleiades and Orion, who turns the shadow of death into morning and darkens day into night, who summons the waters of the sea and pours them out across the earth — the LORD is his name.

verses.kjv: That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.
verses.web: who brings sudden destruction on the strong, so that destruction comes on the fortress.
verses.ct: He brings sudden ruin on the strong and sends destruction crashing down on fortified cities.

verses.kjv: They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.
verses.web: They hate him who reproves in the gate, and they abhor him who speaks blamelessly.
verses.ct: You hate anyone who speaks the truth in court, and you despise anyone who tells it like it is.

verses.kjv: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.
verses.web: Therefore, because you trample on the poor, and take taxes from him of wheat: You have built houses of cut stone, but you will not dwell in them. You have planted pleasant vineyards, but you shall not drink their wine.
verses.ct: Because you trample the poor and squeeze grain taxes out of them — you've built fancy stone houses, but you won't live in them. You've planted beautiful vineyards, but you won't drink their wine.

verses.kjv: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.
verses.web: For I know how many your offenses, and how great are your sins— you who afflict the just, who take a bribe, and who turn away the needy in the courts.
verses.ct: I know how many your sins are and how serious they are. You persecute innocent people, you take bribes, and you deny the poor their rights in court.

verses.kjv: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.
verses.web: Therefore a prudent person keeps silent in such a time, for it is an evil time.
verses.ct: That's why anyone with sense keeps quiet in times like these — because the times are truly evil.

verses.kjv: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the LORD, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.
verses.web: Seek good, and not evil, that you may live; and so LORD, the God of Armies, will be with you, as you say.
verses.ct: Chase after what is good, not what is evil, so that you may live. Then the LORD, the God of hosts, will truly be with you, just as you claim he is.

verses.kjv: Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the LORD God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.
verses.web: Hate evil, love good, and establish justice in the courts. It may be that LORD, the God of Armies, will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.”
verses.ct: Hate evil, love good, and make sure justice is upheld in the courts. Perhaps the LORD God of hosts will show mercy to what's left of Joseph."

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD, the God of hosts, the LORD, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.
verses.web: Therefore LORD, the God of Armies, the Lord, says: “Wailing will be in all the wide ways; and they will say in all the streets, ‘Alas! Alas!’ and they will call the farmer to mourning, and those who are skillful in lamentation to wailing.
verses.ct: So the LORD, the God of hosts, the Lord, says this: "There will be crying in every street and wailing in every public square. People will shout, 'No! No!' They'll call the farmers in from the fields to mourn, and they'll hire professional mourners to lead the weeping.

verses.kjv: And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the LORD.
verses.web: In all vineyards there will be wailing; for I will pass through the middle of you,” says LORD.
verses.ct: Every vineyard will echo with grief, because I will pass right through the middle of you," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Woe unto you that desire the day of the LORD! to what end is it for you? the day of the LORD is darkness, and not light.
verses.web: “Woe to you who desire the day of LORD! Why do you long for the day of LORD? It is darkness, and not light.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for you who long for the day of the LORD! Why would you want that day to come? The day of the LORD will be darkness, not light.

verses.kjv: As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.
verses.web: As if a man fled from a lion, and a bear met him; Or he went into the house and leaned his hand on the wall, and a snake bit him.
verses.ct: It will be like a man who runs from a lion only to bump into a bear — or who finally makes it home, leans his hand against the wall to catch his breath, and gets bitten by a snake.

verses.kjv: Shall not the day of the LORD be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?
verses.web: Won’t the day of LORD be darkness, and not light? Even very dark, and no brightness in it?
verses.ct: Won't the day of the LORD be total darkness instead of light? Pitch black, without a single ray of brightness?

verses.kjv: I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.
verses.web: I hate, I despise your feasts, and I can’t stand your solemn assemblies.
verses.ct: "I hate your religious festivals — I despise them. I can't stand your solemn gatherings.

verses.kjv: Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.
verses.web: Yes, though you offer me your burnt offerings and meal offerings, I will not accept them; neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat animals.
verses.ct: Even if you bring me burnt offerings and grain offerings, I won't accept them. I won't even look at the peace offerings of your fattened animals.

verses.kjv: Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.
verses.web: Take away from me the noise of your songs! I will not listen to the music of your harps.
verses.ct: Get your noisy songs away from me! I refuse to listen to the music of your harps.

verses.kjv: But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.
verses.web: But let justice roll on like rivers, and righteousness like a mighty stream.
verses.ct: Instead, let justice flow like a river, and righteousness like a mighty stream that never runs dry.

verses.kjv: Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
verses.web: “Did you bring to me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, house of Israel?
verses.ct: Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings during those 40 years in the wilderness, house of Israel?

verses.kjv: But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.
verses.web: You also carried the tent of your king and the shrine of your images, the star of your god, which you made for yourselves.
verses.ct: No — instead you carried around the shrine of your king Moloch and Chiun, your star-god idols that you made for yourselves.

verses.kjv: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the LORD, whose name is The God of hosts.
verses.web: Therefore I will cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus,” says LORD, whose name is the God of Armies.
verses.ct: So I will send you into exile far beyond Damascus," says the LORD, whose name is the God of hosts.
